conclusion: To find the angle between the velocity and the horizontal direction when the slider lands at point C, we need to analyze the motion of the slider from point B to point C.
The slider is ejected from point B with an initial velocity v_B. This velocity is horizontal because the slider is ejected from the end of the horizontal platform.
The slider follows a projectile motion from point B to point C. The horizontal distance between B and C is x_{BC} = 0.9 m, and the vertical drop from B to C is h = 0.53 m.
The time of flight t can be found using the vertical motion equation: t = sqrt(2h/g) = sqrt(2 * 0.53/9.8) ≈ 0.33 s
The horizontal velocity v_B = x_{BC}/t = 0.9/0.33 ≈ 2.73 m/s
The vertical velocity v_{yC} at point C can be found using the equation: v_{yC} = g * t = 9.8 * 0.33 ≈ 3.23 m/s
The angle φ between the velocity vector and the horizontal direction at point C can be found using the tangent function: tan φ = v_{yC}/v_B = 3.23/2.73 ≈ 1.18
